question: Where did Jen-Tzong Jeng work?

content.source_1:
Title: The Academic Odyssey of Jen-Tzong Jeng: Unraveling the Threads of a Distinguished Career

In the realm of academia, few individuals have left an indelible mark on their respective fields as profoundly as Jen-Tzong Jeng. A stalwart researcher, Jeng's contributions to the world of science and technology have been nothing short of remarkable. As we delve into the intricacies of his remarkable career, one chapter stands out in particular – his tenure at the National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences in Taiwan. It was the early 2000s when Jeng's academic journey brought him to the doors of this esteemed institution. As a researcher, he was drawn to the university's commitment to fostering innovation and excellence in applied sciences. The university, with its rich history and strong industry connections, provided the perfect platform for Jeng to explore and expand his research interests. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Jeng's affiliation with National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences is his publication record. A thorough examination of his research papers and articles reveals a consistent association with the university during this period. For instance, a 2005 paper titled "An Empirical Study on the Relationship between Knowledge Management and Organizational Innovation" lists Jeng as a corresponding author, with his affiliation clearly stated as the Department of Management, National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences. Furthermore, Jeng's involvement in various research projects and collaborations with faculty members from the university provides additional evidence of his tenure. A 2007 project report on "Developing a Knowledge Management System for Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises" acknowledges Jeng's contributions as a principal investigator, with the university serving as the primary research partner. In addition to his research endeavors, Jeng's teaching engagements at the university also demonstrate his commitment to nurturing the next generation of scholars. Course syllabi and student evaluations from the time period confirm his role as an instructor, imparting his expertise in management and innovation to students. The university's own records and publications also corroborate Jeng's affiliation. The National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences' annual reports and faculty directories from the early 2000s feature Jeng's name, highlighting his research achievements and contributions to the academic community. As we weave together these threads of evidence, a rich tapestry of Jeng's academic career emerges.
content.source_2:
**Breaking News**

Renowned Researcher Jen-Tzong Jeng's Stint at IIT Madras Yields Groundbreaking Discoveries

Chennai, Tamil Nadu - In a significant development, it has come to light that esteemed researcher Jen-Tzong Jeng was affiliated with the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM) for a substantial period. During his tenure, Jeng made substantial contributions to the field of engineering and research, leaving an indelible mark on the institution. According to sources close to the institution, Jeng's association with IITM began in 2015, when he joined as a visiting researcher. Over the next three years, he worked closely with the faculty and students, driving innovation and pushing the boundaries of scientific inquiry. "IITM provided me with the perfect platform to explore new ideas and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the country," Jeng said in an exclusive interview. "The institution's emphasis on interdisciplinary research and its state-of-the-art facilities created an environment conducive to growth and discovery." During his stint at IITM, Jeng was involved in several high-impact projects, including the development of sustainable energy solutions and advanced materials for industrial applications. His work led to the publication of several papers in reputed international journals, earning him recognition from the global scientific community. "Jen-Tzong's contributions to our institution have been immense," said Dr. Bhaskar Ramamurthi, Director of IITM. "His expertise and passion for research inspired our students and faculty alike, and we are grateful for the time he spent with us." Data obtained from IITM's research office reveals that Jeng's projects attracted significant funding from government agencies and private organizations, totaling over ₹5 crores. His work also led to the establishment of a new research center at the institution, focused on developing cutting-edge technologies for the energy sector. Jeng's affiliation with IITM has also had a lasting impact on the institution's international collaborations. His connections with top universities and research institutions worldwide have paved the way for future partnerships and exchange programs, further solidifying IITM's reputation as a hub for innovation and excellence. As Jeng moves on to new challenges, his legacy at IITM remains. His work continues to inspire a new generation of researchers and engineers, and his contributions to the institution will be remembered for years to come.

answer: National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences, Taiwan.
